data.title: Build failed on OS X using GCC 4.9.3
data.body:
I'm trying to build v3.9 in OS X using cmake and GCC 4.9.3 (installed using brew with --with-all-languages flag) but seems that there are some problems with Cocos code here. At first attemtion to get project built i got this: 1. cd cocos3.9 2. mkdir macbuild && cd macbuild 3. Exec cmake like that: 
cmake -G Unix Makefiles
 -DBUILD_CPP_TESTS=OFF
 -DBUILD_LUA_LIBS=OFF 
 -DBUILD_JS_LIBS=FALSE 
 -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER=/usr/local/gcc-4.9.3/bin/g++ 
 -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER=/usr/local/gcc-4.9.3/bin/gcc 
 -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS=-w -std=c++11 
 -DCMAKE_C_FLAGS=-std=gnu99 ..
1. make 2. First compilation fail was related to issue that children classes of cocos/2d/CCNode.h were not able to resolve isnan function, so i hacked it like this: file: cocos/2d/CCNode.h 
   using std::isnan;
3. Next problem which i _currently stuck on_: 
[ 23%] Built target bullet
[ 26%] Built target recast
[ 27%] Built target tinyxml2
[ 27%] Built target unzip
[ 28%] Built target flatbuffers
[ 29%] Built target xxhash
[ 29%] Building CXX object cocos/CMakeFiles/cocos2d.dir/platform/mac/CCApplication-mac.mm.o
In file included from /usr/include/os/object.h:75:0,
                 from /usr/include/dispatch/dispatch.h:48,
                 from /System/Library/Frameworks/CoreFoundation.framework/Headers/CFStream.h:15,
                 from /System/Library/Frameworks/CoreFoundation.framework/Headers/CFPropertyList.h:13,
                 from /System/Library/Frameworks/CoreFoundation.framework/Headers/CoreFoundation.h:55,
                 from /System/Library/Frameworks/Foundation.framework/Headers/Foundation.h:6,
                 from /System/Library/Frameworks/Cocoa.framework/Headers/Cocoa.h:12,
                 from /Users/sandro/cocos2d-x/cocos/platform/mac/CCApplication-mac.mm:29:
/usr/include/objc/NSObject.h:22:4: error: 'instancetype' does not name a type
 - (instancetype)self;
    ^
/usr/include/objc/NSObject.h:36:4: error: 'instancetype' does not name a type
 - (instancetype)retain OBJC_ARC_UNAVAILABLE;
    ^
/usr/include/objc/NSObject.h:38:4: error: 'instancetype' does not name a type
 - (instancetype)autorelease OBJC_ARC_UNAVAILABLE;
    ^
/usr/include/objc/NSObject.h:60:4: error: 'instancetype' does not name a type
 - (instancetype)init
    ^
/usr/include/objc/NSObject.h:66:4: error: 'instancetype' does not name a type
 + (instancetype)new OBJC_SWIFT_UNAVAILABLE("use object initializers instead");
    ^
/usr/include/objc/NSObject.h:67:4: error: 'instancetype' does not name a type
 + (instancetype)allocWithZone:(struct _NSZone *)zone OBJC_SWIFT_UNAVAILABLE("use object initializers instead");
    ^
/usr/include/objc/NSObject.h:68:4: error: 'instancetype' does not name a type
 + (instancetype)alloc OBJC_SWIFT_UNAVAILABLE("use object initializers instead");
    ^
In file included from /System/Library/Frameworks/Foundation.framework/Headers/NSArray.h:5:0,
                 from /System/Library/Frameworks/Foundation.framework/Headers/Foundation.h:10,
                 from /System/Library/Frameworks/Cocoa.framework/Headers/Cocoa.h:12,
                 from /Users/sandro/cocos2d-x/cocos/platform/mac/CCApplication-mac.mm:29:
/System/Library/Frameworks/Foundation.framework/Headers/NSObject.h:19:21: error: 'nullable' does not name a type
 - (id)copyWithZone:(nullable NSZone *)zone;
                     ^
/System/Library/Frameworks/Foundation.framework/Headers/NSObject.h:25:28: error: 'nullable' does not name a type
 - (id)mutableCopyWithZone:(nullable NSZone *)zone;
                            ^
/System/Library/Frameworks/Foundation.framework/Headers/NSObject.h:32:4: error: 'nullable' does not name a type
 - (nullable instancetype)initWithCoder:(NSCoder *)aDecoder; // NS_DESIGNATED_INITIALIZER
    ^
In file included from /System/Library/Frameworks/Foundation.framework/Headers/NSArray.h:5:0,
                 from /System/Library/Frameworks/Foundation.framework/Headers/Foundation.h:10,
                 from /System/Library/Frameworks/Cocoa.framework/Headers/Cocoa.h:12,
                 from /Users/sandro/cocos2d-x/cocos/platform/mac/CCApplication-mac.mm:29:
Having investigated it already two days i haven't came to any useful conclusion yet. Guys, could you please suggest where i can go next at this point? P.S I really need to build project with GCC 4.9+ since my team uses GCC 4.9+. When i try to you use clang project is built successful, however rest of the team facing a lot of issues when they try to compile my code with GCC P.S.S I'm _not_ going to use XCode, since it worst IDE in the world it's completely not possible to use it. I prefer vim.

data.title: Make GL context current before rendering
data.body:
If some other process or UI element (like NSOpenPanel) changes the current OpenGL context, cocos2d-x crashes, so it is impossible to create GUI apps with cocos2d-x on Mac right now. This pull request fixes that by resetting GL context every time before rendering.

I fixed the problem with GL context switching in GLFW 3.1.2 (https://github.com/glfw/glfw/pull/487), so now it is safe to add the code to cocos2d-x.

The bug has been reported before here: http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/issue-with-nsopenpanel-osx/14310

data.title: Fix misspelled APIs in v3.10
data.body:
Hello.
There are several spelling mistakes I found in the new APIs that will be added to v3.10.
This pull request provides the following proposed fixes:
- Replace `ResouceData` class with `ResourceData`
- Rename function in JSB (except `auto`) 
  - `jsval_to_resoucedata` => `jsval_to_resourcedata`
  - `resoucedata_to_jsval` => `resourcedata_to_jsval`
- Fix typo in UI
  - `getCrossDisabeldFile` => `getCrossDisabledFile`
  - `getBallDisabeldFile` => `getBallDisabledFile`

Thanks.

data.title: Button widget with 9-slice enabled cloning problem
Refactored Cocos2dxDownloader
data.body:
- Turned DataTaskHandler and FileTaskHandler into inner classes of Cocos2dxDownloader. These classes are only supposed to be used by Cococ2dxDownloader instances and this way they do not need to be passed a reference to said instances explicitly.
- Removed DownloadTask as it seems to be unnecessary.
- Deprecated the use of static methods to create instances and doing work on instances.
- Using SparseArray instead of HashMap for tracking tasks because they provide the same functionality, without the need to use auto-boxing for the integer keys.

1、3.9版本ios工程默认图标Icon-87.png  Icon-180.png  未加入。
2、<key>CFBundleIconFiles</key>   <key>CFBundleIconFiles~ipad</key>  小节，都缺少.png后缀。

data.title: serious performance issue in removeFromParent
data.body: environment: windows, lua repro steps: 1 create a normal layer, for example, a layer with 200 imageview with the same png ``` lua for i = 1, 200 do local nn = ccui.ImageView:create("ui/jiesuan/jiaoyin.png") self:addChild(nn) end ``` 2 create a button simple to do the create, remove and add action of this layer ``` lua local oldlayer function UIHelper.onBtnClick(clean) local cls = require("ui.map.MapListLayer") perfStart() local layer = cls:create() perfLog("createMap") if (oldlayer) then oldlayer:removeFromParent() perfLog("remove old") oldlayer = nil end gd.UIMgr.UILayer:addChild(layer) oldlayer = layer return layer end ``` 3 you will find the removeFromParent need about 0.2s. The time raises according the node count in layer. Notice that the new layer has not been added to ui yet. 4 Interesting thing is that, if you move the remove action to before cls:create(), the time for removefromparent drop to 0.01s.

data.title: V3
data.body:
Add api for Texture2D get used memory size.
Optimize TextureCache memory manager.

data.title: Fixes #14589 allocation issue with remote images
data.body:
Fix for #14589 - this change allocates a remotely downloaded image on the heap before adding to the texture cache.

Without this change, I see a crash (on Android) after removing the downloaded image from the texture cache. I do not have a test case that reproduces the crash, its hard to isolate from everything thats going on in my game, but it may be during cleanup of a widget that is using the offending texture. This is the crash dump:

`Stack frame #00  pc 01282b20  /data/app-lib/co.superlive.battlestars-88/libcocos2djs.so (cocos2d::ui::Widget::~Widget()+344): Routine cocos2d::ui::Widget::~Widget() at /Users/pan/Superlive/Workspace/battlestars-x/frameworks/runtime-src/proj.android-studio/../../cocos2d-x/cocos/ui/UIWidget.cpp:177
Stack frame #01  pc 0000dd57  /system/lib/libc.so (free+10)`

In any case I believe the change I am proposing here is more consistent with the rest of the codebase for how images are allocated and added to the texture cache, e.g. 
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/renderer/CCTextureCache.cpp#L793

data.title: Crash when removing a remotely downloaded image from texture cache (v3.9 JSB)
data.body:
I'm experiencing a strange crash with remote images added to the texture cache via `cc.textureCache.addImageAsync`

The image is downloaded and added to the cache ok.

Later, when I call `cc.textureCache.removeTextureForKey` with the remote image's url it crashes. The same behaviour works just fine if the image is local rather than downloaded via http.

I think its due to the stack allocation of the image in the Downloader callback here:

https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/scripting/js-bindings/manual/extension/jsb_cocos2dx_extension_manual.cpp#L875

data.title: LabelTTF.enableShadow arguments are inconsistent with JS API
data.body:
According to the [JsDocs](http://www.cocos2d-x.org/reference/html5-js/V3.8/index.html) LabelTTF.enableShadow should accept the following parameters:

```
Parameters:
{cc.Color | Number} a
    Color or The x axis offset of the shadow
{cc.Size | Number} b
    Size or The y axis offset of the shadow
{Number} c
    The blur size of the shadow or The opacity of the shadow (0 to 1)
{null | Number} d
    Null or The blur size of the shadow
```

However, the [equivalent method in 2d-x](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/d0c3275281d03ae319d076a30972ac5fd7512531/cocos/2d/CCLabelTTF.cpp#L189) accepts:

```
LabelTTF::enableShadow(const Size &shadowOffset, float shadowOpacity, float shadowBlur, bool updateTexture)
```

For example, this code in JS would raise an exception on native builds:

``` javascript
var test = new cc.LabelTTF(
    'Test', 
    'Arial', 
    32, 
    null, 
    cc.TEXT_ALIGNMENT_CENTER, 
    cc.VERTICAL_TEXT_ALIGNMENT_CENTER
);
test.enableShadow(cc.color(33, 114, 255, 255), cc.size(0, 0), 15);
```

```
js_cocos2dx_LabelTTF_enableShadow : Error processing arguments
```

Furthermore, the **blurRadius** parameter does not seem to be implemented at all: https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/d0c3275281d03ae319d076a30972ac5fd7512531/cocos/2d/CCLabel.cpp#L877
